content:
Diagnosis:	Stage I (T1bN0M0) EGFR-mutant adenocarcinoma right upper lobe

I reviewed [redacted name] in follow-up clinic today. She completed radical radiotherapy (55Gy in 20 fractions) to the right upper lobe primary in January 2024, having declined surgery. She has been on Osimertinib 80mg daily since February 2024 following detection of an EGFR L858R mutation.

She reports feeling well with stable breathing and no new symptoms. Her exercise tolerance remains good, managing daily 30-minute walks. Performance status remains 0.

CT thorax performed last week shows stable appearances of the treated right upper lobe primary lesion measuring 2.1cm (previously 2.2cm). No evidence of nodal or distant disease.

Blood tests show stable biochemistry and full blood count. Her latest CEA is 3.2 (previously 3.5).

The plan is to continue Osimertinib at current dose with next CT scan in 3 months. We will review her again following those results.

primary_cancer.biomarker_status: EGFR L858R mutation positive, PD-L1 80%, ALK negative

cancer_timeline.value: Completed radical radiotherapy 55Gy in 20 fractions to right upper lobe primary
Started Osimertinib 80mg daily following detection of EGFR L858R mutation
CT thorax shows stable right upper lobe primary lesion measuring 2.1cm (previously 2.2cm), no nodal or distant disease

patient_facts.value: Stable biochemistry and full blood count

status_updates.value: Stage I EGFR-mutant lung adenocarcinoma. Stable disease on Osimertinib following radical radiotherapy
Stable disease on imaging with marginal reduction in primary lesion size
